title: Lewis Hamilton sparks concern with social media post stating: 'I feel like giving up on everything'
text:
Lewis Hamilton sparked worries for his mental wellbeing after posting an Instagram message where he claimed he “felt like giving up on everything”. A day after Extinction Rebellion protestors were ordered to stop demonstrating in London, the five-time world champion wrote a series of laments – all of which he later deleted – about environmental destruction.

While Hamilton is on the cusp of sealing his sixth Formula One championship, it is the danger of global ecological disaster that has been preoccupying him most of late. “Honestly, I feel like giving up on everything,” he told his 13.1 million followers. “Shut down completely. Why bother when the world is such a mess and people don’t seem to care? I’m going to take a moment away to gather my thoughts. Thank you to those of you who do give a damn about the world.”

Hamilton has recently embraced veganism and last month opened his own Neat Burger restaurant in central London, using only plant-based products. “Extinction of our race is becoming more and more likely as we overuse our resources,” he said. “Agriculture farming is the largest pollutant we currently have by over 50 per cent, far more than our travel industry combined. I’m sad to see so many people, even close friends, ignore what is happening daily.
description: Lewis Hamilton sparked worries for his mental wellbeing after posting an Instagram message where he claimed he “felt like giving up on everything”.
